title: 106_s2162
content:
The Price-Anderson Amendments Act of 2000 updates indemnification authority for NRC licensees, DOE contractors, and nonprofit educational institutions. It also increases the maximum assessment to $20,000,000 and adjusts the DOE liability limit. The Price-Anderson Amendments Act of 2000 updates indemnification authority for NRC licensees, DOE contractors, and nonprofit educational institutions. It increases the maximum assessment to $20,000,000 and adjusts the DOE liability limit to $10,000,000,000 for all persons indemnified. The Price-Anderson Amendments Act of 2000 updates indemnification authority for NRC licensees, DOE contractors, and nonprofit educational institutions by amending agreements of indemnification to reflect the amount of indemnity for public liability and financial protection required of the contractor. SEC. 5. INCIDENTS OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES.

Amends the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 to increase the amount of indemnification and liability limit to $500,000,000.

SEC. 6. REPORTS.

Amends the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 to change the reporting deadline to August 1, 2008.

SEC. 7. INFLATION ADJUSTMENT. SEC. 7. INFLATION ADJUSTMENT. Amends the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 to require the Secretary to adjust indemnification amounts every 5 years based on the Consumer Price Index. SEC. 8. CIVIL PENALTIES. Amends the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 to repeal automatic remission and limit civil penalties for nonprofit institutions. SEC. 9. EFFECTIVE DATE. The amendments made by this Act will be effective upon enactment. Certain provisions regarding indemnification and civil penalties will not apply to incidents or violations occurring before the enactment date.
